summary: Reorganize the proto packages by decomposing the monolithic common and enums packages into specific purpose-driven packages. This improves code organization, eliminates enum naming conflicts and prefixes, and allows for better separation of concerns between shared API definitions and server-specific messages.
userImpact: Users will benefit from cleaner API namespaces, removal of enum prefixes in CLI and Web interfaces, and better alignment with protobuf v2 standards.
rootCause: Monolithic common and enums packages were designed to match Thrift layout for migration simplicity, but this creates poor naming practices, enum collisions, and locks the project to gogo compiler.
proposedFix: Decompose common and enums into specific packages (decision, event, execution, filter, namespace, query, replication, tasklist, version). Move server-specific messages to temporal server repo. Use pb suffix for package aliases in Go imports.
resolutionDetails: Implemented via PR #16 which completed the proto package reorganization as proposed.
keyQuote: Split common and enums packages into many specific packages having messages and enums in them. Allow to avoid enum collisions and remove prefixes.
